intro: Lepidagathis psilantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. It is well adapted to dry environments, with succulent leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. Lepidagathis psilantha is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is a common component of desert vegetation.
